trial_identification.studytitle: The Glycaemic Index of Manuka Honey
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The Glycaemic Index of Manuka Honey

interventions.interventions:
Other interventions - Manuka Honey
Experimental: honey - Manuka honey
Other interventions: Manuka Honey honey was weighed out to provide 25 g of available carbohydrate in 200 ml of water

primaryOutcome.outcome: Determine the Glycaemic index of Manuka honey - 10 healthy individuals consumed honey (25g of available carbohydrate in 200 ml of water) in a fasted state. Blood glucose levels were recorded at 0, 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 mins and the area under the blood glucose curve was calculated. All 10 participants took five different honeys and a glucose standard on six different days (with randomised allocation of samples).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- healthy (Body mass index (BMI) 20-25)
- non-smoking
- aged between 18-45 years
- absence of diabetes or chronic illness
- not taking any medications.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- currently dieting
- suffering from illness or chronic disease
- currently taking medication
- smokers (including recreational)
- outside healthy BMI range

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Five high methylglyoxal (460-667 mg/kg) Manuka honey samples were selected from different geographical locales around the North Island of New Zealand and tested for glycaemic index (GI) in 10 healthy volunteers in a single-blinded, randomised study. Participants were fed honey containing 25g of available carbohydrate in 200 ml water and the blood glucose responses measured (area under the curve; AUC) and compared to that of 25 g of available carbohydrate from glucose.
